author: tim.heidfeld
title: Global Identity and Authentication
description: アイデンティティがなければ、所有権もなく、経済的進歩もなく、繁栄もなく、法的拘束力のある行動もありません。

f6_assessments.q0: この提案が提示する問題と解決策は、確かに正しい課題であると言えます。デジタル・アイデンティティは、将来の経済取引において最も重要であり、データの個人的所有権を強調するソリューションは、成功裏に採用されるために最も望まれる側面となるでしょう。本提案は、この課題の加速を支援することを目的としているため、その影響力と整合性に同意します。この提案が最高得点を獲得できなかったのは、この課題をどのように達成するかを明確に説明できなかったことにあります。高レベルの記述が多いが、何が構築されるのか、個人データの収集はどのように行われるのか（特にバイオメトリックデータ）、指紋、フェイススキャン、アイリススキャンなどを収集する際の法的な問題は何か、これらの収集された個人情報が1-Click fulfillmentにどのように結びつくのか（誰が結びつくのか）など、詳細な説明が不十分である。
f6_assessments.q1: 提案書にはチームメンバーの名前が記載され、それぞれの資格がLinkedInに掲載され、iamx.comのウェブサイトからアクセスできるようになっていますが、計画の形がないため、このプロジェクトの実現可能性については確信が持てません。目標と利点の「要約」は、非常に高いレベルでポイント形式で記述されています。これは、簡単な要約としては良いのですが、930000ドルを要求する提案書としてはうまく表現できません。実現可能性を高めるためには、実行可能な計画の明確なタイムラインでこの提案を書き直すことを提案します。これにより、有権者は、始まりと終わりがあり、その間の各段階には、明確に説明されたコストがあることを確信することができます。提案書には、個人、国（ガーナ）、生態系に対する成果と利益が記載されていますが、どうやってそこに到達するのかという実質的な情報がないまま、あまりにも先走りすぎています。また、なぜガーナなのかという説明も必要でしょう。iamxチームは、私の知る限り、ドイツに拠点を置いています。ガーナの企業との既存の関係は、この国をパイロットに理想的な国にしていますか？
f6_assessments.q2: 要求された93,000ドルの資金には、この金額を構成するものの明確な内訳がありません。これは、あらゆるプロジェクトの監査や審査に不可欠なものです。さらに、チームがどのように活動を開始し、誰がどのような役割で参加し、どこで／いつ終了するのかを説明する計画もありませんでした。これらの非常に重要な点が欠けていたことが、監査可能性の面で評価が低くなった理由です。私の提案は、この提案全体を、賛成・反対の投票をする前に提案書をざっと見ただけの投票者にも簡単にわかるように、明確に書き直すことです。また、提案チームは、他の成功した提案者に相談するか、過去の提案を見て、資金要求を成功させるためにどのような要素が必須であるかを知ることも有益である。iamxのウェブサイトには、WADAアライアンスとの関連が表示されているので、資金調達に成功したWADAアライアンスのチームと連絡を取ることを提案する。彼らは、Catalystで支持を得るために必要な適切な詳細を知っているはずです。IAMXは、IOGのIdentity Ecosystemセクションに掲載されている1/3のチームであり、IOHK自身によって与えられたステータスを考えると、この提案はほとんど侮辱的です。IAMXのスタッフは資格を持った人たちですが、内容のほとんどが彼らのウェブサイトから引用されているため、この提案の作成には努力が払われていないようです。IAMXにはアクティブなプールがあり、ツイッターでも活発に活動しているので、その意味ではコミュニティから責任を問われるチャンネルがあると言えます。

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications:  in my year long work in political organisations I have been both a treasurer of a political organisation and a financial auditor (someone that checks the books of an organisation to verify that all the funds proceedings are in order). Hence, I can bring in some competencies in evaluating the budgets in this category on their credibility and accountability. In addition to this, I'm a catalyst member and CA for quite some while and have generally a good understanding of the different topics of the ecosystem and of how the proposal process works and what good proposals need. The proposal identifies a very important problem regarding DID: the lack off accessibility of identity itself and the cosequencies from it. It approaches this problem with a valid solution that will both benefit the Cardano ecosystem and the people that suffer from a lack of identity. The solution provided is very detailed and well-made. The key metrics and goals of the proposal align excellently with the outlined challenge settings.
Since WADA is a great multiplicator and keeps establishing, and the related business seems serious and credible, it can sure be said that the proposal is able to scale to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
WADA are a really active and established part of the Catalyst community. Without a doubt they and their project partners will be able to successfully implement this proposal. The proposers know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal and basically have a large group as their support network. 
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and is reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposal offers a realistic timetable and roadmap to complete the work and a very detailed, rationable and transparent implementation plan. It describes the resources used and every imaginable detail is shown. This is a great example of a good, feasible proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Well-defined, detailed metrics and an auditable roadmap are presented that define the success of the proposal. A clear, understandable problem description is accompanied by a very detailed, auditable description of a solution.

f6_assessments.q0: I disagree that this proposal aligns with the objectives of the challenge. The idea can be defined by the following passage: "provide free and solid biometric identity, owned and controlled by the holder". In theory this is great, but where does Cardano come in, where does Atala Prism fit in? Unfortunately, during the description of this project, the proponents focused on explaining the product but not on making us understand how it would benefit the Cardano ecosystem. At no point is it said that the decentralized identity would be stored on our blockchain. There's not much else to say, unfortunately. There is no point in offering so many advantages to the final customer, who would have these services free of charge, from what can be inferred, and not benefit those who would be financially supporting the idea... I suggest that the proponents clarify this issue better, because I have read the proposal completely and it is still not clear to me how this bridge would take place.
f6_assessments.q1: We have and do not have information about the team here. I'm gonna explain. Are some companies mentioned that would be part of the project (IAMX AG, Zug, CH), would the executive board be the leaders of these organizations? Would a total of 25 people be involved in the project? It would be essential to know who they are, individually. Names, positions, how they would work on the project, professional training, who would be responsible for the development in Cardano... It is positive that they clarify the industry sector and the business model, but at the same time, some information is somewhat loose, such as for example, we only have contact information for these companies (IAMX). It is very positive that they anticipate the risk of so many different aspects, such as software risk, product risk and so on. This demonstrates a lot of experience in the development of this project. However, it is essential, in my opinion, that we know the characteristics of the members individually, this is what builds greater trust in the team: a more humanized notion about who we are dealing with. About the script: totally absent. The team provides us with a lot of relevant information about the project, such as benefits for customers, risks, objectives, etc., but at no time are phases and activities to be carried out to achieve the goals determined. It is not possible to understand how the development process of this project would take place. And finally, in terms of funding, nothing is said about how the 93k orders would be used! It is essential to share the money, how much would go for each thing and because, it is a very high value and without any explanation that justifies it, it is very difficult for the community to judge if it is a fair or exaggerated amount...
f6_assessments.q2: The best part of the proposal. The team is willing to provide some very relevant information that would serve as a way of auditing the project, even though they have not traced a roadmap (through which we could monitor whether the activities were being carried out as promised) and KPIs. This information is: the objectives (indirectly, I would say they are the KPIs of the proposal); the results (they could also be called KPIs!); the benefits (through them, we can monitor if what was planned for the client was actually carried out, in addition to conducting a direct survey with the public to understand their degree of satisfaction) and risk analysis (here we have an idea of ​​the problems that would be faced and you can monitor whether they were avoided and/or resolved). It's the part that became clearest in my view, both the team could gather such data and wash it to the rest of the community; how much a local resident who was already part of the Cardano community could make contact with the team and take the information to the rest of us.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal includes some technical jargon but is severely lacking in real substance. Too few specific details are provided to judge the impact. Of course, we are all excited about the possibilities of digital identity, but this this proposal doesn't really offer a detailed solution to any problem and does not communicate any technical nuance. The project summary includes many commendable goals that are appropriate for the challenge but doesn't go into detail about how these goals will be achieved.
f6_assessments.q1: Frankly I'm confused by this proposal because the quality of the the team as listed on the website is very high, but the content on the website and in the proposal are severely lacking in detail and not convincing. The proposers do go into some detail in the comments section of ideascale when responding to questions, but these responses are similar to the proposal body in their tone. Their ISPO stake pool has 4M in delegation so they must have some trust from the community. I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt that this is a language/communications issue rather than a scam, but I can't give more than two stars considering the quality of the information presented in the proposal and on the website.
f6_assessments.q2: No KPIs or auditability points are provided. No detailed road map/calendar.  no budget breakdown for the 93k requested.

solution: 保有者が所有・管理する自由で強固なバイオメトリクスID、および検証者が認める検証可能なクレデンシャルの提供
experience: テレコミュニケーション、E-コマース、電子マーケットプレイス、エコファッション、自動車、コンサルティングなどの分野で活躍するE-コマース創業者の実績
